CancelInvocation.document:
This API is used to cancel the command executed on one or more CVM instances.

* If the command has not been delivered to the TAT agent, the task status is `PENDING`, `DELIVERING`, or `DELIVER_DELAYED`, and will be `CANCELLED` after the command is canceled.
* If the command has been delivered to the TAT agent, the task status is `RUNNING`, and will be `TERMINATED` after the command is canceled.
CancelInvocation.name: Cancels the execution of a command

CreateCommand.document: This API is used to create a command.
CreateCommand.name: Creates a command

CreateInvoker.document: This API is used to create an invoker.
CreateInvoker.name: Creates an invoker

DeleteCommand.document:
This API is used to delete a command.
Commands bound to an invoker cannot be deleted.
DeleteCommand.name: Deletes a command

DeleteInvoker.document: This API is used to delete an invoker.
DeleteInvoker.name: Deletes an invoker

DescribeAutomationAgentStatus.document: This API is used to query the status of the TAT agent.
DescribeAutomationAgentStatus.name: Queries the agent status

DescribeCommands.document: This API is used to query command details.
DescribeCommands.name: Queries command details

DescribeInvocationTasks.document: This API is used to query execution task details.
DescribeInvocationTasks.name: Queries the execution tasks

DescribeInvocations.document: This API is used to query execution activity details.
DescribeInvocations.name: Queries the execution activities

DescribeInvokerRecords.document: This API is used to query the execution history of an invoker.
DescribeInvokerRecords.name: Queries the execution history of an invoker

DescribeInvokers.document: This API is used to query invoker details.
DescribeInvokers.name: Queries invokers

DescribeRegions.document:
This API is used to query the list of regions that supports TAT.
If the `RegionState` is `AVAILABLE`, it means that TAT is available in the region. If no value is returned, TAT is not available in the region.
DescribeRegions.name: Queries regions that support TAT

DisableInvoker.document: This API is used to disable an invoker.
DisableInvoker.name: Disables an invoker

EnableInvoker.document: This API is used to enable an invoker.
EnableInvoker.name: Enables an invoker

InvokeCommand.document:
This API is used to trigger a command on the specified instance and returns the execution activity ID (inv-xxxxxxxx) on success. Each execution activity has one or more execution tasks (invt-xxxxxxxx) and each execution task indicates an execution record on a CVM or Lighthouse instance.

* If the agent is not installed on the instance or is offline, an error is returned.
* If the command type is not supported by the agent runtime environment, an error is returned.
* The specified instance needs to be in a VPC network.
* The specified instance needs to be in the RUNNING status.
* Only one type of instances (CVM or Lighthouse) can be specified in a single request.
InvokeCommand.name: Triggers a command

ModifyCommand.document: This API is used to modify a command.
ModifyCommand.name: Modifies a command

ModifyInvoker.document: This API is used to modify an invoker.
ModifyInvoker.name: Modifies an invoker

PreviewReplacedCommandContent.document: This API is used to preview the command with custom parameters. The command is not executed.
PreviewReplacedCommandContent.name: Previews a command

RunCommand.document:
This API is used to execute a command and returns the execution activity ID (inv-xxxxxxxx) on success. Each execution has one or more execution tasks (invt-xxxxxxxx) and each execution task indicates an execution record on a CVM or Lighthouse instance.

* If the agent is not installed on the instance or is offline, an error is returned.
* If the command type is not supported by the agent runtime environment, an error is returned.
* The specified instance needs to be in a VPC network.
* The specified instance needs to be in the `RUNNING` status.
* Only one type of instances (CVM or Lighthouse) can be specified in a single request.
RunCommand.name: Executes a command

members.name: Content

members.document: Command type. `SHELL` and `POWERSHELL` are supported. The default value is `SHELL`.
members.name: CommandType

members.document: Command execution path. The default value is /root for `SHELL` commands and C:\Program Files\qcloud\tat_agent\workdir for `POWERSHELL` commands.
members.name: WorkingDirectory

members.document: Command timeout period. Default value: 60 seconds. Value range: [1, 86400].
members.name: Timeout

members.document:
Whether to enable the custom parameter feature.
This cannot be modified once created.
Default value: `false`.
members.name: EnableParameter

members.document:
The default value of the custom parameter value when it is enabled. The field type is JSON encoded string. For example, {\"varA\": \"222\"}.
`key` is the name of the custom parameter and `value` is the default value. Both `key` and `value` are strings.
If no parameter value is provided in the `InvokeCommand` API, the default value is used.
Up to 20 custom parameters are supported.
The name of the custom parameter cannot exceed 64 characters and can contain [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9] and [-_].
members.name: DefaultParameters

members.document: Tags bound to the command. At most 10 tags are allowed.
members.name: Tags

members.document:
The username used to execute the command on the CVM or Lighthouse instance.
The principle of least privilege is the best practice for permission management. We recommend you execute TAT commands as a general user. By default, the root user is used to execute commands on Linux and the System user is used on Windows.
members.name: Username

members.document: The COS bucket URL for uploading logs. The URL must start with `https`, such as `https://BucketName-123454321.cos.ap-beijing.myqcloud.com`.
members.name: OutputCOSBucketUrl

members.document:
The COS bucket directory where the logs are saved. Check below for the rules of the directory name. 
1. It must be a combination of number, letters, and visible characters. Up to 60 characters are allowed.
2. Use a slash (/) to create a subdirectory.
3. Consecutive dots (.) and slashes (/) are not allowed. It can not start with a slash (/).
members.name: OutputCOSKeyPrefix

members.document:
Filter conditions.
  • `agent-status` - String - Required: No - (Filter condition) Filter by agent status. Valid values: `Online`, `Offline`.
  • `environment` - String - Required: No - (Filter condition) Filter by the agent environment. Valid value: `Linux`.
  • `instance-id` - String - Required: No - (Filter condition) Filter by the instance ID.
    Up to 10 `Filters` allowed in one request. For each filter, five `Filter.Values` can be specified. `InstanceIds` and `Filters` cannot be specified at the same time.
members.name: Filters

members.document: Number of returned results. It defaults to `20`. The maximum is 100. For more information on `Limit`, see the relevant section in the API [Overview](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/api/213/15688?from_cn_redirect=1).

members.document:
Filter conditions.
  • `command-id` - String - Required: No - (Filter condition) Filter by the command ID.
  • `command-name` - String - Required: No - (Filter condition) Filter by the command name.
  • `command-type` - String - Required: No - (Filter condition) Filter by the command type. Valid values: `SHELL` or `POWERSHELL`.
  • `created-by` - String - Required: No - (Filter condition) Filter by the creator. Valid values: `TAT` (public commands) or `USER` (custom commands).
  • `tag-key` - String - Required: No - (Filter condition) Filter by the tag key.
  • `tag-value` - String - Required: No - (Filter condition) Filter by the tag value.
  • `tag:tag-key` - String - Required: No - (Filter) Filter by the tag key-value pair. The tag-key should be replaced with a specified tag key. For detailed usage, see sample 4.
    • Up to 10 `Filters` are allowed in one request. Each filter can have up to 5 `Filter.Values`. `CommandIds` and `Filters` cannot be specified at the same time.
members.name: Filters

Filter.document:
> Key-value pair filters for conditional filtering queries, such as filtering ID, name, and status.
> * If there are multiple `Filter` parameters, the relationship among them is the logical `AND`.
> * If there are multiple `Values` for the same `Filter`, the relationship among the `Values` for the same `Filter` is the logical `OR`.
>
> Take the [DescribeInstances](https://intl.cloud.tencent.com/document/api/213/15728?from_cn_redirect=1) API as an example. You can use the following filters to query the instances whose availability zone (`zone`) is Guangzhou 1 ***and*** billing method (`instance-charge-type`) is prepaid ***or*** pay-as-you-go:
```
Filters.0.Name=zone
&Filters.0.Values.0=ap-guangzhou-1
&Filters.1.Name=instance-charge-type
&Filters.1.Values.0=PREPAID
&Filters.1.Values.1=POSTPAID_BY_HOUR
```

members.document:
Execution task status. Valid values:
<li> PENDING: Pending 
<li> DELIVERING: Delivering
<li> DELIVER_DELAYED: Delivery delayed 
<li> DELIVER_FAILED: Delivery failed
<li> START_FAILED: Failed to start the command
<li> RUNNING: Running
<li> SUCCESS: Success
<li> FAILED: Failed to execute the command. The exit code is not 0 after execution.
<li> TIMEOUT: Command timed out
<li> TASK_TIMEOUT: Task timed out
<li> CANCELLING: Canceling
<li> CANCELLED: Canceled (canceled before execution)
<li> TERMINATED: Terminated (canceled during execution)
members.name: TaskStatus

<li> PENDING: Pending 
<li> DELIVERING: Delivering
<li> DELIVER_DELAYED: Delivery delayed 
<li> DELIVER_FAILED: Delivery failed
<li> START_FAILED: Failed to start the command
<li> RUNNING: Running
<li> SUCCESS: Success
<li> FAILED: Failed to execute the command. The exit code is not 0 after execution.
<li> TIMEOUT: Command timed out
<li> TASK_TIMEOUT: Task timed out
<li> CANCELLING: Canceling
<li> CANCELLED: Canceled (canceled before execution)
<li> TERMINATED: Terminated (canceled during execution)

members.document:
Custom parameters of the command. The field type is JSON encoded string. For example, {\"varA\": \"222\"}.
`key` is the name of the custom parameter and `value` is the default value. Both `key` and `value` are strings.
If no parameter value is provided, the DefaultParameters of the command is used.
Up to 20 custom parameters are supported.
The name of the custom parameter cannot exceed 64 characters and can contain [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9] and [-_].
members.name: Parameters

members.document:
The username used to execute the command on the CVM or Lighthouse instance.
The principle of the least privilege is the best practice for permission management. We recommend you execute TAT commands as a general user. If this is not specified, the Username of the command is used by default.
members.name: Username

members.document: Execution path of the command. The WorkingDirectory of the command is used by default.
members.name: WorkingDirectory

members.document: Command timeout period. Value range: [1, 86400]. The Timeout of the command is used by default.
members.name: Timeout

members.document: The COS bucket URL for uploading logs. The URL must start with `https`, such as `https://BucketName-123454321.cos.ap-beijing.myqcloud.com`.
members.name: OutputCOSBucketUrl

members.document:
The COS bucket directory where the logs are saved. Check below for the rules of the directory name. 
1. It must be a combination of number, letters, and visible characters. Up to 60 characters are allowed.
2. Use a slash (/) to create a subdirectory.
3. ".." can not be used as the folder name. It cannot start with a slash (/), and cannot contain consecutive slashes.
members.name: OutputCOSKeyPrefix

members.document:
The default value of the custom parameter value when it is enabled. The field type is JSON encoded string. For example, {\"varA\": \"222\"}.
All parameters are overwritten. All default values are required for modification.
Modification is only allowed when `EnableParameter` is `true`.
`key` is the name of the custom parameter and `value` is the default value. Both `key` and `value` are strings.
Up to 20 custom parameters are supported.
The name of the custom parameter cannot exceed 64 characters and can contain [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9] and [-_].
members.name: DefaultParameters

members.document:
The username used to execute the command on the CVM or Lighthouse instance.
The principle of least privilege is the best practice for permission management. We recommend you execute TAT commands as a general user.
members.name: Username

members.document: The COS bucket URL for uploading logs. The URL must start with `https`, such as `https://BucketName-123454321.cos.ap-beijing.myqcloud.com`.
members.name: OutputCOSBucketUrl

members.document:
The COS bucket directory where the logs are saved. Check below for the rules of the directory name. 
1. It must be a combination of number, letters, and visible characters. Up to 60 characters are allowed.
2. Use a slash (/) to create a subdirectory.
3. ".." can not be used as the folder name. It cannot start with a slash (/), and cannot contain consecutive slashes.
members.name: OutputCOSKeyPrefix

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: ID of the invoker to be modified.
members.name: InvokerId

members.document: Name of the invoker to be modified.
members.name: Name

members.document: Invoker type. It can only be `SCHEDULE` (recurring invokers).
members.name: Type

members.document: ID of the command to be modified.
members.name: CommandId

members.document: The username to be modified.
members.name: Username

members.document: Custom parameters to be modified.
members.name: Parameters

members.document: List of instance IDs to be modified. Up to 100 IDs are allowed.
members.name: InstanceIds

members.document: Scheduled invoker settings to be modified.
members.name: ScheduleSettings

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document:
Custom parameters for the preview. The field type is JSON encoded string. For example, {\"varA\": \"222\"}.
`key` is the name of the custom parameter and "value" is its specified value. Both "key" and "value" are strings.
At most 20 custom parameters are supported.
The name of the custom parameter cannot exceed 64 characters and can only contain [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9], [-_].
This parameter can be left empty if DefaultParameters is set for the previewed CommandId.
members.name: Parameters

members.document:
The command to be previewed. If DefaultParameters is set, it is combined with Parameters and Parameters takes priority.
`CommandId` or `Content` must be specified.
members.name: CommandId

members.document:
Base64-encoded command to be previewed. The maximum length is 64 KB.
CommandId or Content must be specified.
members.name: Content

members.document: Base64-encoded command with custom parameters.
members.name: ReplacedContent

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Region name, such as `ap-guangzhou`
members.name: Region

members.document: Region description, such as `Guangzhou`
members.name: RegionName

members.document: Region status. `AVAILABLE` indicates the region is available.
members.name: RegionState

members.document: Base64-encoded command. The maximum length is 64 KB.
members.name: Content

members.document:
IDs of instances about to execute commands. Up to 100 IDs are allowed. Supported instance types:
<li> `CVM`
<li> `LIGHTHOUSE`
members.name: InstanceIds

members.document: Command name. The name can be up to 60 bytes, and contain [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9] and [_-.].
members.name: CommandName

members.document: Command description. The maximum length is 120 characters.
members.name: Description

members.document: Command type. `SHELL` and `POWERSHELL` are supported. The default value is `SHELL`.
members.name: CommandType

members.document: Command execution path. The default value is /root for `SHELL` commands and C:\Program Files\qcloud\tat_agent\workdir for `POWERSHELL` commands.
members.name: WorkingDirectory

members.document: Command timeout period. Default value: 60 seconds. Value range: [1, 86400].
members.name: Timeout

members.document:
Whether to save the command. Valid values:
<li> `True`: Save
<li> `False`: Do not save
The default value is `False`.
members.name: SaveCommand

members.document:
Whether to enable the custom parameter feature.
This cannot be modified once created.
Default value: `false`.
members.name: EnableParameter

members.document:
The default value of the custom parameter value when it is enabled. The field type is JSON encoded string. For example, {\"varA\": \"222\"}.
`key` is the name of the custom parameter and `value` is the default value. Both `key` and `value` are strings.
If Parameters is not provided, the default values specified here are used.
Up to 20 custom parameters are supported.
The name of the custom parameter cannot exceed 64 characters and can contain [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9] and [-_].
members.name: DefaultParameters

members.document:
Custom parameters of `Command`. The field type is JSON encoded string. For example, {\"varA\": \"222\"}.
`key` is the name of the custom parameter and `value` is the default value. Both `key` and `value` are strings.
If no parameter value is provided, the `DefaultParameters` is used.
Up to 20 custom parameters are supported.
The name of the custom parameter cannot exceed 64 characters and can contain [a-z], [A-Z], [0-9] and [-_].
members.name: Parameters

members.document: The tags of the command. It is available when `SaveCommand` is `True`. A maximum of 10 tags are allowed.
members.name: Tags

members.document:
The username used to execute the command on the CVM or Lighthouse instance.
The principle of least privilege is the best practice for permission management. We recommend you execute TAT commands as a general user. By default, the user `root` is used to execute commands on Linux and the user `System` is used on Windows.
members.name: Username

members.document: The COS bucket URL for uploading logs. The URL must start with `https`, such as `https://BucketName-123454321.cos.ap-beijing.myqcloud.com`.
members.name: OutputCOSBucketUrl

members.document:
The COS bucket directory where the logs are saved. Check below for the rules of the directory name. 
1. It must be a combination of number, letters, and visible characters. Up to 60 characters are allowed.
2. Use a slash (/) to create a subdirectory.
3. ".." can not be used as the folder name. It cannot start with a slash (/), and cannot contain consecutive slashes.
members.name: OutputCOSKeyPrefix

members.document: Command ID.
members.name: CommandId

members.document: Execution activity ID.
members.name: InvocationId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document:
Execution policy:
  • `ONCE`: Execute once
  • `RECURRENCE`: Execute repeatedly
members.name: Policy

members.document: Trigger the crontab expression. This field is required if `Policy` is `RECURRENCE`. The crontab expression is parsed in UTC+8.
members.name: Recurrence

members.document: The next execution time of the invoker. This field is required if `Policy` is `ONCE`.
members.name: InvokeTime

members.document: Tag key.
members.name: Key

members.document: Tag value.
members.name: Value

members.document: ExitCode of the execution.
members.name: ExitCode

members.document: Base64-encoded command output. The maximum length is 24 KB.
members.name: Output

members.document: Time when the execution is started.
members.name: ExecStartTime

members.document: Time when the execution is ended.
members.name: ExecEndTime

members.document: Dropped bytes of the command output.
members.name: Dropped

members.document: COS URL of the logs.
members.name: OutputUrl

members.document: Error message for uploading logs to COS.
members.name: OutputUploadCOSErrorInfo
